definitions: A fruit pouch snack - initially referred only to the Blédina brand's fruit pouch that has a little nou-nours (French diminuitive for bear) on some of its packaging
Sort of a nothing's going on at the moment, fill the silence by calling out māp and waiting for the other person to respond blobble, then laugh together
Very happy sound with the expectation that papa or mama join in on the final baaaaaaaa
Translates in a sing-song way to say “I love youuuu Papa" or any other <u>fill-in-the-blank</u> person or animal or item
One specific little bird for a brief period of a few days in a book I can no longer remember the name of
Pants, trousers, pantaloons, pajamas, playing with words before bedtime and finding a funny sound
All kinds of dinosaurs: pterodactyls, t-rexes, stegasauri (?), the occasional dragon, etc.
Papa scooping up the little baby, sitting on the ground, then rocking back (scoooooop) and forward (yyyyyyyy)
A pineapple, in particular a cool, Italian puzzle toy, but it also applies to the real, spiky, delicious fruit
A playful, formulaic suffix that can add an -ah sound to the end of a bunch of fill-in-the-blank words. Kind of a dimunitive, cute form of speech
A basketball - a funny, chimeric word, my little one learned the French scarabée (beetle) and around the same time she first heard the word basketball
Really fun way to bypass the difficult, guttural rhotic in the French word for yogurt
Workmanlike acknowledgment, kind of a ‘gotta work hard to pay the bills' vibe, repeated back and forth a couple times. Usually used when helping me clean up her high chair.
Noise indicating to herself and everyone around that she's ‘about to take a big bite' of her food
